VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023 Renewal: Corrective Action Plan was recorded during this reporting period as
a result of the Renewal Inspection completed on 10/06/2023. This CAP contained
four violations for employee files regarding missing three references prior to hire,
verification of education, completion of an annual evaluation, and verification of
tuberculosis screening prior to hire. The facility immediately corrected the files that
needed updated information. The facility implemented a checklist that specifically
lays out what needs to be completed prior to hire and leadership completes
quarterly audits on employee files. This CAP also contained two violations for youth
files regarding verification of dental records and completion of a discharge report.
The facility implemented a system with the nursing team to coordinate dental exam
per the rules requirements and completed a training with supervisor about the
requirements of discharge reports. In order to remain ongoing compliance,
leadership is completing quarterly audits of their youth files.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they feel well supported by their direct supervisor and
administration team. The staff reported with the addition of new staff at the facility
they are working on making sure all staff are consistent with the youth. Chief
Administrator reported over the past year they have implemented a new process
into their annual evaluation to best support the staff in developing their skill set. The
3

supervisors now complete a mini evaluation of the staff once a quarter so staff can
constantly be developing.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth all reported their voices are being heard at the facility and if
there is ever a grievance filed, staff take it seriously. They reported staff use verbal
de-escalation skills more than going hands on with the youth.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on September 16,
2024. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
